intro: Tirucalia intisy, commonly known as Indian frankincense, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, resinous sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish flowers. Its resin, often referred to as "tiruchandana," has been traditionally used in religious and medicinal practices. The botanical features of Tirucalia intisy make it an important species in both ecological and cultural contexts.
